Species.Name: Aqualish
Species.Description: [H4]Aqualish[h4] The Aqualish are tusked bipeds from the planet Ando whose appearance combined aspects of arachnids and pinniped aquatic mammals. Aqualish had a reputation for being nasty, crude and aggressive, and generally pursued off-world careers as mercenaries, bounty hunters, and pirates. One of the most infamous such Aqualish was the smuggler Ponda Baba. [P][B]Physiology:[b] An amphibious species native to the planet Ando, the Aqualish people are made up of three distinct races which included the Aquala, the Ualaq and the Quara. Although they all had their differences, their baseline genetic structure was the same and their appearances did not vary so drastically as to characterize them as different species. All Aqualish have two facial tusks which curved down over their mouths; a trait which adds to their appearance as arachnids. Indeed, the Aqualish have some arachnid genetic material in their distant past, as demonstrative in their relationship with the Harch species. These facial tusks are highly sensitive to heat and cold, and were used for cracking open the hard shells of shellfish or burrowing through the swampy loam of their homeworld. [P][B]Society:[b] The Aquala hate their Quara relatives, as they blame them for the image the Aqualish had on the galaxy as thugs. Because of this the latter subspecies are considered pariahs on Ando, which has a lower population of Aqualish than the galaxy itself. All three Aqualish subspecies speak mutually intelligible dialects of the same language. Quarrelsome and thug-like, the Aqualish culture revolves around aggression and toughness, with diplomacy being one of their weakest attributes. [P][B]Homeworld:[b] Ando, the homeworld of the Aqualish, is an oceanic planet located in the Ando system of the Mid Rim. The sea covers 95% of the world. The majority of the world's islands are sustained by a decaying swamp ecosystem and covered in steamy mist. [P][B]Language:[b] Aqualish is the official language of the planet Ando, spoken by the Aqualish species. The three subspecies of Aqualish—Aquala, Quara and Ualaq—each have a different dialect. However, these regionalisms are so similar that they are easily understood by speakers of the separate dialects. [P]Aqualish vocal cords cause harsh guttural sounds, which are common in the Aqualish language, but uncommon in Basic. If an Aqualish speaks Galactic Basic Standard, it sounds coarse and brutish. Most Aqualish do not learn Basic unless they needed to, which usually means they have been forced to leave their homeworld.
